folder: State Street & Hoyt Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
(1)
343-351 State Street, north side, between Hoyt and Bond Streets, showing St. Nicholas Syrian Greek Orthodox Catholic Church and Sunday
School.
May 25, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
2)
The same, showing a close up of the Church at No. 351.
May 25, 1929.
P. L. SPerr.
(3)
The same, showing burned hall of the church at No. 349.
May 25, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Hoyt Street & State Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Hoyt Street, west side, north from near State Street. Also seen in the left foreground, is 191-195 Schermerhorn Street at the N.W. corner of Hoyt Street. In the background may be seen the Fulton Elevated
lines of the B.M.T.
October 5, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: State Street & Hoyt Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
(1)
305 State Street, north side, west from Hoyt Street, showing Congegation Mount Sinai, Jewish Synagogue.
May 25, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing the Beth Elohim Synagogue organized in i86i by the former members of the Beth Israel congregation. Now, 1929, fhe edifice is
known as the Mt. Sinai Synagogue.
About 1890
E. L. Armbruster Collection.
